action.action-desc: Ms. Castor of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Power Act to authorize the allocation of the costs of certain interstate electric power transmission lines and electric power transmission lines that are located offshore, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Enhancing Electric Grid Resilience Act.

section.header: Allocation of costs of certain transmission facilities
section.text: Part II of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 824 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Allocation of costs of certain transmission facilities

paragraph.text: Any entity that proposes to own, control, or operate a transmission facility of national significance may file a tariff with the Commission in accordance with section 205 and the regulations of the Commission allocating the costs of such transmission facility of national significance.

The Commission shall require that any tariff filed under paragraph (1) allocate the costs of a transmission facility of national significance to customers within the applicable transmission planning region or regions in a manner that is at least roughly commensurate with the estimated anticipated benefits described in paragraph (3).

The Commission shall require that any tariff filed under paragraph (1) allocate costs based on the broad range of reliability, economic, public policy, resilience, and other reasonably anticipated benefits of the applicable transmission facility of national significance.

subsection.text: In this section, the term transmission facility of national significance means—

paragraph.text: an interstate electric power transmission line (and any facilities necessary for the operation of such electric power transmission line) or an electric power transmission line that is located offshore (and any facilities necessary for the operation of such electric power transmission line)—

subparagraph.text: that has a transmission capacity of not less than 1,000 megawatts; and
the construction of which is completed on or after the date of enactment of this section; or

paragraph.text: an expansion of, or upgrade to, an interstate electric power transmission line (and any facilities necessary for the operation of such electric power transmission line) or an electric power transmission line that is located offshore (and any facilities necessary for the operation of such electric power transmission line) that—

subparagraph.text: increases the transmission capacity of such electric power transmission line by at least 500 megawatts; and
is completed on or after the date of enactment of this section.

subsection.text: This section does not affect the authority of the Commission to approve the allocation of costs of transmission facilities other than transmission facilities of national significance.
